Key Match Events: Pascal Siakam scored 26 points in the Pacers' 129-113 victory over the Bulls.
Thomas Bryant added a season-high 22 points and eight rebounds.
Tyrese Haliburton had 16 points and 13 assists.
Zach LaVine led the Bulls with 31 points.
Coby White had 19 points and five assists.
Post-Match Reflections: Chicago played its way back into the playoff mix with its recent resurgence.
Indiana has played its best stretch of basketball over the past month.
The Pacers didn't need center Myles Turner, who missed the game with an illness, to keep the momentum going.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indiana led 36-18 early in the second quarter and Chicago never got within single digits again.
The Pacers led by 34 in the third quarter.
Chicago cut the deficit to 14 several times in the fourth quarter.
The Bulls had 14 first-half turnovers compared to four for Indiana.
Haliburton now has 51 assists and five turnovers in Indiana's last six games.
